thread.title: Australia Post chairman asked to appear at Senate estimates to justify high salaries
thread.title_full: Australia Post chairman asked to appear at Senate estimates to justify high salaries

author: Lucy Battersby
title: Australia Post chairman asked to appear at Senate estimates to justify high salaries
text:
Counterfeit Holden Commodore bonnet latch ... Counterfeit Holden Commodore bonnet latch warning 
Holden has identified dangerous faults in counterfeit Commodore bonnets that are being fitted to Australian cars and has warned consumers over non-genuine parts used by crash repairers. More videos Turnbull: AusPost boss' salary is 'too high' 
Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull believes Australia Post CEO Ahmed Fahour is overpaid, saying his $5.6 million salary is "too high" for running the government-owned company. Courtesy ABC News 24 . 
Five other executives received salaries ranging from $1.3 million to $1.8 million. And departing chief operating officer Ewan Stafford received a $380,000 retirement benefit. 
The committee was particularly angry that Australia Post had been trying to withhold this information from public scrutiny. Related Content Senate committee tells Australia Post it can't keep the CEO's salary a secret 
Communications Minister Mitch Fifield told the Senate during question time on Thursday that committee chair Senator James Paterson has requested Mr Stanhope appear at Senate estimates on February 28 to justify this pay packet. 
Mr Stanhope is a former chief financial officer and director of Telstra. He was appointed chair of Australia Post in November 2012 for a seven-year-term. Advertisement 
Senator Fifield noted that as a shareholder minister, he recognised that Australia Post operates in a competitive environment. However, this did not justify the secrecy. 
"The Australian community deserves high levels of accountability and transparency from government business enterprises," Senator Fifield told the chamber. SHARE
